author: cswimr
aurora.description: Aurora is a fully-featured moderation system. It is heavily inspired by GalacticBot, and is designed to be a more user-friendly alternative to Red's core Mod cogs. This cog stores all of its data in an SQLite database.
aurora.end_user_data_statement:
This cog stores the following information:
- User IDs of accounts who moderate users or are moderated
- Guild IDs of guilds with the cog enabled
- Timestamps of moderations
- Other information relating to moderations

tickettool.description: Have you ever wanted to set up a Tickets system, with many options for the user and the support team, on your server? Then this cog is for you! It has many settings, buttons, a reaction to create the ticket, many commands working in the ticket channel, different roles with access to different options... There is also a system of panels!
tickettool.end_user_data_statement: This cog records all the data needed to operate the ticket system. It records the reason for the ticket, the open/close dates, the members who have opened/closed/claimed a ticket. author: Flame442
battleship.description: Play battleship against a friend or an AI opponent. Generates an image to represent the board state. Run [p]battleship to play!
battleship.end_user_data_statement: This cog does not store user data.

author: Flame442
deepfry.description: Apply filters to an image to deepfry or nuke it. Supports frying images automatically as they are sent, the most recent image, a linked image, an attached image, and profile pictures. Run [p]deepfry and [p]nuke to fry!
deepfry.end_user_data_statement: This cog does not store user data.

author: Flame442
face.description: Find and describe the faces in an image.
face.short: Find and describe the faces in an image.

author: Flame442
gameroles.description: Grant roles when a user is playing a specific game, and take them away when they stop. This can be used to create channels that can only be accessed by people who are currently playing a certain game, or who have ever played a certain game. This cog detects games by checking the status of the user, so users who use the privacy setting to disable statuses will not be granted roles. Run [p]gameroles to configure!
gameroles.end_user_data_statement: This cog does not store user data.
gameroles.short: Grant roles when a user is playing a specific game.

author: Flame442
giftaway.description: Create first come, first serve key giveaways. The command [p]giftaway can be used used with the name of a game and a list of keys to generate an embed that allows users to click a button to be granted one of the listed keys. The keys are given immediately to the first users that request them, they are not raffled off. If an IGDB api key is set, the embed will contain a description of the game and its box art.
giftaway.short: Create first come, first serve key giveaways.

author: Flame442
hangman.description: Play hangman, guessing a random word from the bot. By default, a list of english nouns is used when picking the word, but a custom list can be configured by the bot owner. Run [p]hangman to play!
hangman.end_user_data_statement: This cog does not store user data.

author: Flame442
hider.description: Hide commands from users in help. Running [p]hider hide allows a particular command to be hidden from the output of [p]help. This does not prevent the command from being run, use [p]command disable for that instead. If [p]helpset showhidden is enabled, this cog will be unable to hide commands.
hider.end_user_data_statement: This cog does not store user data.
hider.short: Hide commands from users in help.

author: Flame442
monopoly.description: Play a game of monopoly with members of your server, or against AI opponents. Generates an image to represent the board state. Many house rules can be configured to match any ruleset. Run [p]monopoly to play!
monopoly.end_user_data_statement: This cog stores user ids in order to identify the players in saved games.

author: Flame442
onlinestats.description: View information about whether users on your server are using discord on desktop or mobile, or what device a particular user is using. Run [p]onlinestats or [p]onlineinfo to see this information.
onlinestats.end_user_data_statement: This cog does not store user data.
onlinestats.short: View information about whether users on your server are using discord on desktop or mobile.

author: Flame442
partygames.description: Chat games focused on coming up with words from 3 letters. Contains gamemodes for writing a word the fastest, writing the longest word, writing the most words, or being able to keep writing words without getting three strikes. Run [p]partygames to play!
partygames.end_user_data_statement: This cog does not store user data.
partygames.short: Chat games focused on coming up with words from 3 letters.

author: Flame442
pokemonduel.description: Battle in a Pokemon Duel with another member of your server. Supports all moves, abilities, and pokemon from generation 8, with partial item support and partial support for generation 9 additions. Also supports the inverse type effectiveness format. Run [p]pokemonduel to play!
pokemonduel.end_user_data_statement: This cog stores user ids in order to track your party of pokemon.
pokemonduel.short: Battle in a Pokemon Duel with another member of your server.

author: Flame442
simpleembed.description: Create and send simple embeds through the bot. Only the description, color, and large image fields of the embed can be modified. Run [p]sendembed to create an embed!
simpleembed.end_user_data_statement: This cog does not store user data.

author: Flame442
stocks.description: Buy and sell real world stocks at live prices Red currency. Stocks are bought at a ratio of 100 credits per $1, and change in value with the real world stock price. This cog requires an API integration to fetch the current stock prices. Use [p]stocks to buy!
stocks.end_user_data_statement: This cog stores a user id in order to know what stocks have been purchased by each user. Data is only collected when a user directly interacts with the cog and its commands.
stocks.short: Buy and sell stocks with bot currency.

author: Flame442
uttt.description: Play ultimate tic tac toe against another member of your server. In ultimate tic tac toe, you may only play in the sub board that corresponds to the last spot your opponent played. If you are sent to a sub board that has been finished, you can choose any sub board. First to win three sub boards in a row wins. Run [p]uttt to play!
uttt.end_user_data_statement: This cog does not store user data.
uttt.short: Play ultimate tic tac toe against another member of your server.

author: Flame442
wordstats.description: Tracks the most commonly used words by every member and in every server. The number of times a word has been said by a particular member, server, or globally can be retrived from [p]wordstats. The users with the most words said in a particular server or globally can be retrieved from [p]topchatters. The users who have said a word more frequently compared to other users in a particular server or globally can be retrieved from [p]topratio.
wordstats.end_user_data_statement: This cog persistently stores the number of times every unique word is said per-user per-guild. Data is collected on every message the bot can see unless the guild, channel, or user have opted out. Users can request that their data is deleted using `[p]wordstatsset forgetme` and can request to opt out of data collection using `[p]wordstatsset user no`.

author: Tobotimus
docref.description: DocRef allows you to look up references on documentation webpages by their sphinx object names - this includes any documented python object! The documentation webpages must be added to the bot with a site name (of your own choice) and URL. The documentation webpages must be generated by sphinx (this includes almost every documentation page on ReadTheDocs).
docref.short: Search for references on documentation webpages.

errorlogs.end_user_data_statement: This cog does not store end user data.
errorlogs.short: Log error tracebacks in text channels.

author: Tobotimus
reactkarma.description: ReactKarma is a cog for counting upvotes and downvotes of everyone the bot sees. The karma leaderboard is global, however the cog can be effectively enabled and disabled per-server.
reactkarma.short: Like Reddit Karma, but with discord reactions!

author: Tobotimus
sticky.description: Sticky is a cog for sticking a message at the bottom of a channel. When a user sends a message in that channel, the bot will delete its old message and repost it, so it 'sticks' to the bottom.

author: Tobotimus
streamroles.description:
StreamRoles is a cog for automatically assigning roles to users streaming on Twitch. The cog is also able to only assign a streaming role to users of a particular game. Specific users can also be blacklisted and whitelisted.

Disclaimer: The first streamrole cog was made by tmerc, as some of you may know. This cog was written completely from the ground up by myself, and although I was unaware he had written a similar cog already, he should be given credit for coming up with the idea first.

author: Tobotimus
strikes.description: Strikes is a cog for helping moderation teams warn and keep track of misbehaving users. Strikes are filed with a reason and timestamp, and the cog is helpful for knowing how many times the user has misbehaved *recently*. ModLog integration is also available.

author: Tobotimus
updatered.description:
UpdateRed is a cog for updating your bot from within discord. When combined with the ability to restart the bot, updating Red becomes a easier than ever!

You can choose from multiple automatic versions, or specify a particular version you'd like to install.

author: Tobotimus
welcomecount.description: WelcomeCount is a cog for sending customisable and context-based welcome messages to new users. It's named after it's main feature - it counts how many members have joined each day, and this can be included in the welcome message.

betteruptime.description: Replace the uptime command with a rich embed that shows the bot's percentage uptime (both time of the bot being on and time connected to Discord). There is also a new `downtime` command which shows when downtime happened. This cog writes to config every 60 seconds to prevent data loss. It is also very storage efficient, using under 150 bytes each day the cog runs.

cmdlog.description: Track who used what commands. All command usage is logged to the bot's console/log and also internally cached. You can view the activity of an individual user, server or command. Supports slash and text commands.
cmdlog.end_user_data_statement:
This cog may persistently store data or metadata about users. Operational data is temporarily collected and cached whenever a command is used and may be stored.

When a command is used, the following data is collected: the message invoking the command, the user that invoked it, the server it was invoked in, and the channel it was invoked in. This includes application commands, as well as old-style text commands.

This cog does not support data deletion requests, as it handles operational data.
cmdlog.short: Track who uses what commands, with the ability to search for a specific user, server command.

author: hollowstrawberry
simulator.description:
Designates a channel that will send automated messages mimicking your friends using Markov chains. They will have your friends' avatars and nicknames too! Inspired by /r/SubredditSimulator and similar concepts.

🧠 It will learn from new messages sent in configured channels, and only from users with the configured role. Will only support a single guild.

⚙ The bot owner must configure it with [p]simulator set, then they may manually feed past messages using [p]simulator feed [days]. This may take 1 minute per 5000 messages, so be patient!

🔄 While the simulator is running, simulated conversations will randomly occur. Trying to type in the output channel will delete the message and trigger a conversation.

👤 A user may permanently exclude themselves from their messages being read and analyzed by using the [p]dontsimulateme command. This will also delete all their data.
simulator.end_user_data_statement:
This cog will locally store and analyze past and future messages sent by participating users, in order to generate new messages in an owner-configured output channel.
You may opt out completely and delete your simulator data with the [p]dontsimulateme command.
simulator.short: Simulates messages from your friend group.

whois.description:
Whois for server members. Set, update, and look up names to keep track of who is who. 
Usages: 
`[p]avatar member` - Posts a full resolution image of a specified user's profile picture
`[p]emoji emoji` - Posts a full resolution image of a specified emoji
`[p]whois member` - Look up name
`[p]theyare member name` - Set name 
`[p]iswho name` - Look up a username given their whois name 
`[p]iseveryone` - Lists all members of the server (without pinging!) and their whois names
`[p]import_whois` - privileged users can export a whois database. File to import should be attached to the command message.
`[p]export_whois` - Privileged users can export the whois DB to file
